snippet: Sebastian Coe was elected president of the International Association of Atlhetics Federations on Wednesday in Beijing and set out his ambitions, including an assault on doping.
abstract: Christopher Clarey On Track and Field column notes election of Sebastian Coe as president of the International Association of Athletics Federations; holds Coe's biggest challenge will be putting end to widespread and systematic doping  in order to bring credibility back to sport with waning support worldwide.
lead_paragraph: Sebastian Coe was elected president of the International Association of Atlhetics Federations on Wednesday in Beijing and set out his ambitions, including an assault on doping.

headline.print_headline: Group’s New Leader Aims to Save ‘My Sport’
headline.main: Hard Climb Awaits Sebastian Coe, New President of I.A.A.F.
